Task 1:
Topic 1: Introduction to AI Agents 

Task Description: 
Your task is to gain a foundational understanding of what Artificial Intelligence (AI) Agents are. This includes learning about the conceptual framework of AI agents including the definition of an agent in an AI context, types of AI agents (simple reflex, model-based reflex, goal-based and utility-based), and how they perceive their environment and make decisions. 

Estimated Time to Complete: 
Approximately 10-15 hours. This can vary depending on your current familiarity with the subject. 

Recommended Resources: 
1. Book: "Artificial Intelligence: Structures and Strategies for Complex Problem Solving" by George F. Luger.
2. Video: Lecture series on AI by Prof. Patrick Winston, MIT OpenCourseWare. 
3. Website: AI Topic notes on ‘Agents and Environments’ on Stanford’s Introduction to AI Course website.

Topic 2: Learning Algorithms for AI Agents

Task Description: 
Your task is to understand the concept of learning algorithms that are used in AI agents. This would include gaining knowledge on the functionality of algorithms like reinforcement learning, unsupervised learning, supervised learning, and semi-supervised learning. Also, understanding key concepts like overfitting, underfitting, bias-variance tradeoff and cross-validation is needed.

Estimated Time to Complete: 
Approximately 15-20 hours. This estimate can vary depending on your current familiarity with algorithms and your speed of learning.

Recommended Resources:
1. Book: "Machine Learning: A Probabilistic Perspective" by Kevin P. Murphy.
2. Video: Machine Learning Course by Andrew Ng on Coursera.
3. Website: AI Topic notes on 'Learning Algorithms' on the University of Cambridge's Machine Learning and Real-world Data course website.
